hanzi-su-wiki:
曜

Значения

День недели

Мнемоника

  • Голубовато-синие перья фазана 瞿 в лучах солнца 日 блестят как планеты солнечной системы. Воскресенье связывали с солнцем, понедельник — с луной и т.д.

  • В начале дня птицы поют "piyo-piyo" (ピヨ).
purpleculture_pinyin:
yào
bright; glorious; one of the seven planets of premodern astronomy
яркий; славный; одна из семи планет досовременной астрономии

曜曜RS𣇪𤒂weekday, glorious, as sun, daylight, sunlight, one of the seven planets of pre-modern astronomy (the sun, the moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn)

purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A spectacular 翟 star 日; 翟 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
七曜 [ qī yào ]: the seven planets of premodern astronomy (the Sun, the Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn)
土曜日 [ tǔ yào rì ]: Saturday (used in ancient Chinese astronomy)
黑曜石 [ hēi yào shí ]: obsidian (mining)
日曜日 [ rì yào rì ]: Sunday (used in ancient Chinese astronomy)
星曜 [ xīng yào ]: heavenly bodies (esp. the sun, moon or five visible planets)

• ⿰ Left to right
    • 日 [ rì ] sun; day; daytime
    • 翟 [ dí ] long-tailed pheasant; plume; surname
heisig_constituent: weekday, sun, day, futon, feathers, wings, turkey
koohiiStory1: Tip: feathers + turkey : This combination of primitives appears six times in Heisig, so it´s worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest "futon" (your futon is made from turkey feathers). REF: weekday (FRAME 576) , laundry (#577), leap (#1285), outstanding (#2272), twinkle (#2534), shimmering (#2880). Story: On weekdays you hang your futon out in the sun.
koohiiStory2: The poor farmer spends every weekday while the sun shines, plucking turkey feathers.

曜日(ようび): day of the week

金曜日(きんようび): Friday
月曜日(げつようび): Monday

土曜日(どようび): Saturday

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: As the sun rises over the hills, the ferocious wolverine stalks a turkey on a weekday morning. The wolverine hunts turkeys for a living, but on the weekends, he likes to play racquetball at the local gym. That’s why the turkey is getting hunted on a weekday.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You’ve probably seen those nature shows like on National Geographic. Think back to one of those shows where the hunter stalks its prey and leaps out in slow motion to do the murder. Now imagine this scene with the wolverine leaping out at the turkey. The wolverine howls a bloodcurdling shriek as the turkey lurches in agony, feathers flying everywhere as the wolverine sinks its teeth into flesh.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This wolverine has a strange palate, however. It likes to turn its turkey into turkey yogurt (よう). After the hunt every weekday, the wolverine spends the evening turning the turkey meat into a strange, thick and chunky, turkey yogurt.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine eating this turkey yogurt. It tastes pretty much exactly how you would expect. Chunks of turkey meat mixed with thick and creamy yogurt. It tastes like mushy Thanksgiving. Imagine eating this every day of the week.

曜字的基本解释

曜
yào
照耀；明亮：“日出有曜”。
日、月、星均称“曜”，日、月、火、水、木、金、土七个星合称“七曜”，旧时分别用来称一个星期的七天，如“日曜日”是星期日，“月曜日”是星期一，其余依次类推。

曜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yào］
［《廣韻》弋照切，去笑，以。］
(1)明亮；光辉。
(2)日、月、五星均称“曜”。
(3)炫耀；显示。
(4)照耀；辉映。
(5)用同“躍”。

曜字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【日字部】　曜； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页501第11
〔古文〕??【廣韻】弋照切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】弋笑切，?音燿。日光也。【釋名】光明照耀也。【詩·檜風】日出有曜。【前漢·韋?成傳】光曜晻而不宣。【玉篇】亦作燿。

曜字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
曜字的起名意思

：照耀、明亮；日、月、星均称“曜”；炫耀、显示。

Yao
Basic explanation of words
Yao
yào
Shine; bright: "Sunrise has light."
The sun, moon, and stars are all called "Lu", and the seven stars of sun, moon, fire, water, wood, gold, and earth are collectively called "Seven Lu". In the old days, they were used to refer to the seven days of a week. "Monday" is Monday, and the rest can be deduced by analogy.
Yao
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yào］
["Guangyun" Yi according to the cut, to laugh, to. ]
(1) Bright; brilliant.
(2) The sun, the moon, and the five stars are all called "Yao".
(3) Show off; display.
(4) Shining; shining.
(5) Use the same "jump".
Yao

[Chen Ji 1] [Japanese Character Department] 　 Yao; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 501 No. 11
[Ancient text]?? [Guang Yun] Yi Zhaoqie [Jiyun] [Rhyme Club] [Zheng Yun] Yi Xiaoqie, sound shining. Nikko also. [Release name] Bright light shines too. 【Poetry·Hinoki】There is light at sunrise. [Previous Han Wei? Cheng Chuan] Guangyao was dark and unannounced. [Jade articles] also make shining.

Yao
Name meaning
: Shine, bright; sun, moon, and stars are all called "Yao"; show off and show.
yào
I сущ.
1) солнечный свет; блеск, отсвет
影曜 тень и свет
日出有曜 когда солнце взойдёт, появляется блеск
2) кит. астр, светило
七曜 семь светил (Солнце, Луна и пять планет; также дни недели, называемые их именами, напр.: 月曜日 понедельник)
九曜 девять светил (окружающих Сев. полюс и связанных с девятью областями неба и, соответственно, с девятью областями Китая; Солнце, Луна, пять планет и два пункта прохождения Луны через эклиптику — 罗睺, санскр. Rapu, и 计都, Vetu, т. е. исходящий и входящий узлы)
II гл.
озарять; сверкать, ослеплять; светлый, яркий
曜野 озарять равнину (поля)

曜

Значения

День недели

Мнемоника

  • Голубовато-синие перья фазана 瞿 в лучах солнца 日 блестят как планеты солнечной системы. Воскресенье связывали с солнцем, понедельник — с луной и т.д.

  • В начале дня птицы поют "piyo-piyo" (ピヨ).
Radicals: 日, ヨ, 隹  (sun, wolverine, turkey)
Meaning Mnemonic
As the sun rises over the hills, the ferocious wolverine stalks a turkey on a weekday morning. The wolverine hunts turkeys for a living, but on the weekends, he likes to play racquetball at the local gym. That’s why the turkey is getting hunted on a weekday.
You’ve probably seen those nature shows like on National Geographic. Think back to one of those shows where the hunter stalks its prey and leaps out in slow motion to do the murder. Now imagine this scene with the wolverine leaping out at the turkey. The wolverine howls a bloodcurdling shriek as the turkey lurches in agony, feathers flying everywhere as the wolverine sinks its teeth into flesh.
Reading Mnemonic
This wolverine has a strange palate, however. It likes to turn its turkey into turkey yogurt (よう). After the hunt every weekday, the wolverine spends the evening turning the turkey meat into a strange, thick and chunky, turkey yogurt.
Imagine eating this turkey yogurt. It tastes pretty much exactly how you would expect. Chunks of turkey meat mixed with thick and creamy yogurt. It tastes like mushy Thanksgiving. Imagine eating this every day of the week.
